document.docAuthor: Costa, Samuel Geremias Dos Santos, Klompen, Hans, Bernardi, Leopoldo Ferreira De Olivei- Ra, Gonçalves, Luciana Cardoso, Ribeiro, Dante Batista & Pepato, Almir Rogério
document.docTitle: Lasioerythraeus jessicae Costa & Klompen & Bernardi & Gonçalves & Ribeiro & Pepato 2019, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Multi-instar descriptions of cave dwelling Erythraeidae (Trombidiformes: Parasitengona) employing an integrative approach

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Multi-instar descriptions of cave dwelling Erythraeidae (Trombidiformes: Parasitengona) employing an integrative approach

mods:name.mods:namePart: Bernardi, Leopoldo Ferreira De Olivei- Ra

taxonomicName.authority: Costa & Klompen & Bernardi & Gonçalves & Ribeiro & Pepato, 2019
taxonomicName.authorityName: Costa & Klompen & Bernardi & Gonçalves & Ribeiro & Pepato

subSubSection.paragraph: Larva : Palp setal formula: B-B-BBB-6B1ζ1ω; Dorsal setae heteromorphic with two shapes: flagelliform and bladelike ( Fig. 3E ); fn Ge 8-8-8; fn Ti 15-15-15. No variation could be observed because only one larval specimen was available.

Type Material .
Holotype : Larva UFMG
AC 161067
collected by active search at 19°05’46.0”S , 43°21’25.0”W , in an iron ore terrain cave, Conceição do Mato Dentro municipality, Minas Gerais State , Brazil , between
July 26 and October 13
of 2016
.
Paratype deutonymph: UFMG
AC 161064
.
Paratype females: UFMG
AC 161061
,
161062 , 161068 , 161069 and 161070
(
See Table I
for detailed collecting data). The specimens were collected in the entrance and penumbra zone of unnamed caves
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 4.
Lasioerythraeus jessicae
sp. nov. larva. A: Leg I; B: Leg II; C: Leg III; D: Distal portion of tarsus I; E: Distal portion of tarsus II; F: Distal portion of tarsus III. Scale: A, B, C= 200 µm; D, E, F= 50 µm.

TABLE II. Metric data for the larval specimens of
Leptus sidorchukae
sp. nov. ,
Lasioerythraeus jessicae
sp. nov. , and five new specimens of
Charletonia rocciai Treat & Flechtmann, 1979
. Some of the metric characters are not applicable for all species and are marked by (NA).

taxonomicName.authorityName: Costa & Klompen & Bernardi & Gonçalves & Ribeiro & Pepato

subSubSection.paragraph: Leg I: Ta—24B, 2 ζ, 1 ω, 1ɛ; Ti—15B, 1κ, 2 φ; Ge—8B, 1κ, 1 σ; Tf—5B, Bf—4B; Tr—1B; Cx—1B.
Leg II: Ta—21B, 1 ζ, 1 ω; Ti—15B, 2 φ; Ge—8B, 1κ; Tf—5B; Bf—4B; Tr—1B; Cx—1B.
Leg III: Ta—22B, 1 ζ; Ti—15B,1 φ; Ge—8B; Tf—5B; Bf—3B; Tr—1B; Cx—1B.

caption.paragraph:
TABLE III. Metric data for the deutonymphs of
Leptus sidorchukae
sp. nov. ,
Lasioerythraeus jessicae
sp. nov. , and five new specimens of
Charletonia rocciai Treat & Flechtmann, 1979
. Some of the metric characters are not applicable for all species and are marked by (NA). * Those characters were measured relative to the anterior eye for
Lasioerythraeus
which has two pairs of eyes.

taxonomicName.authority: Costa & Klompen & Bernardi & Gonçalves & Ribeiro & Pepato, 2019

tr.th:
Le. sidorchukae
sp. nov. Mean (n=5) Range

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 5.
Lasioerythraeus jessicae
sp. nov. deutonymph. A: General view, black arrow pointing the anal pore; B: Crista metopica, eye plate indicated; C and D: Palp dorsal and ventral view, arrow pointing the gnathosoma lips; E: Tarsus and tibia I; F: Palp tarsus and tibia, arrow pointing two spines; G: Anal pore; H: Undeveloped genital plate; I: Eye plate, arrow heads indicating a pair of heteromorphic setae. Scale: A= 1000 µm; B and E= 200 µm; C and D= 100 µm; F, G, H and I= 50 µm.

FIGURE 6.
Lasioerythraeus jessicae
sp. nov. Female. A: General view. B: Tibia and tarsus I. C: Joint between tibia and tarsus I, arrowhead pointing one of the numerous dorsal solenidia. D: Joint between genu and tibia I. Scale: A= 2000 µm; B= 200 µm; C and D= 50 µm.

FIGURE 7.
Lasioerythraeus jessicae
sp. nov. Female. A: Gnathosoma ventral view, arrow pointing at dorsal robust setae, arrow head pointing to punctations on the palp-femur. B: Gnathosoma dorsal view, arrow pointing to the spines on palp-tibia. C: Crista metopica, eye plate circled. D: Genital pore superficial view. E: Genital pore internal structures showing the genital acetabula (G. ac.). F: Palp tiba and tarsus. G: Anal pore. Scale: A–E= 200 µm; F and G= 100 µm.

TABLE IV. Metric data for the females of
Leptus sidorchukae
sp. nov. ,
Lasioerythraeus jessicae
sp. nov. and
Charletonia rocciai Treat & Flechtmann, 1979
. Some of the metric characters are not applicable for all species and are marked by (NA). * Those characters were measured in relation to the anterior eye for
Lasioerythraeus
which has two pairs of eyes.
